summary: I haven't read the Killing Eve book Series. How good are they compared to TV Show?
question: I haven't read the Killing Eve book Series. How good are they compared to TV Show?
answer: i haven’t either i’ve heard from friends that they’re not AS good but still are super enjoyable. the second one apparently gets sexy so if you want to get your villaneve fix, read them. that being said, im probably not going to read them just because i want to consume the show without having an preconceived plot expectations from the books, you know?

reblog.comment: i haven’t either i’ve heard from friends that they’re not AS good but still are super enjoyable. the second one apparently gets sexy so if you want to get your villaneve fix, read them. that being said, im probably not going to read them just because i want to consume the show without having an preconceived plot expectations from the books, you know?

trail.content_raw: i haven’t either i’ve heard from friends that they’re not AS good but still are super enjoyable. the second one apparently gets sexy so if you want to get your villaneve fix, read them. that being said, im probably not going to read them just because i want to consume the show without having an preconceived plot expectations from the books, you know?
trail.content: i haven’t either i’ve heard from friends that they’re not AS good but still are super enjoyable. the second one apparently gets sexy so if you want to get your villaneve fix, read them. that being said, im probably not going to read them just because i want to consume the show without having an preconceived plot expectations from the books, you know?

tags: i love eve and her MIND
summary: We talk a lot about how resourceful Villanelle can be when manipulating literal children and how little she cares about how her...
caption:
We talk a lot about how resourceful Villanelle can be when manipulating literal children and how little she cares about how her end goal/results will make them feel, but I wanted to take my time to focus on how Eve does the same thing just to get what she wants because even though the way they do it is not much of a 1:1 parallel since their gambits are paced differently, the emotional beats are definitely comparable, to the point their actions can/will coax them together…

The fact that Eve is taken aback by the truth about her job being “boring” tells us enough about her as it is. Her job is not proceeding according to her desires, and neither are the people (”It’s not our job.” - “I’ve been compiling these cases for months.”), so she will use her persuasiveness. For example, there is that harrowing moment of resolution - asking Niko for Dom’s number after she went to the boy to have an audio recording translated too - which reveals that Eve’s done fucking around and ready to deceive some people. Dom is older than the boy from Tuscany, sure, a teenager who has been knowing the Polastris for a while I assume, which also makes it a little “less harming”, but Eve still risks everything with him by her side just to get her Interview with Kasia, “It’s only two or three questions. Just say you’re her cousin,” puts him in just as much danger as someone like Villanelle would.

My favorite thing is that at any point during this process, Eve will also indulge in a moment of a visually-inflected reflection which should in no way be taken as a harmless detour into the restroom (*high-pitched keening sound of distress*)

And yes, even when her actions and choices will break things into a million quivering pieces she also doesn’t find her chill but goes on *jazz hands*

summary: Why We're Addicted to 'Killing Eve' and its Season 2 Trailer
title: Why We're Addicted to 'Killing Eve' and its Season 2 Trailer
body:
The first trailer for ‘Killing Eve’ season 2 is finally here, and it’s thrilling.

Killing Eve season 2 poster. Photo courtesy of BBC America, screenshot by Linda Maleh.

On Thursday, February 14, Valentine’s Day, the BBC America hit series Killing Eve dropped their first trailer for season 2, which premiers on April 7. If you haven’t seen it, Killing Eveis about Eve Polastri (Sandra Oh), an MI5 agent who starts chasing the assassin Villanelle (Jodie Comer) across Europe, and…

View On WordPress

body:
Calling the KE fandom

Hi people!

I am asking for help. I am looking for an artist to draw a commission for me 🙂 I would like to have a personalised KE picture on this blog avatar but as I am the shittiest drawer ever I need someone to help me.

I don’t know if you know someone who takes commission (I am still not used to knowing who are the artists among us). I will love you forever if you can help me.

BTW: Do the fandom has a name?

body:
Killing eve thought

So in the last episode of se one, eve says that villanelle cost her jobs, husband and a best friend but really when you think about it villanelle only killed Bill, eve lost her jobs and husband through her own obsession she has with villanelle, so eve needs to realise she caused her life to spiral out of control, not anyone else. And that’s the tea

summary: Someone remind me that I’m supposed to start The Gifted next.  I keep forgetting about it and I really do want to watch it. But...
body:
Someone remind me that I’m supposed to start The Gifted next.  I keep forgetting about it and I really do want to watch it.

But apparently I’m going to watch Killing Eve first.
